vice-president.translation[0].definition: the person who is next in rank to the president of a country and who is responsible for the presidentâ€™s duties if he or she is unable to do them
someone who is responsible for a particular part of a company
vice-president.translation[1].definition: the title given in some organizations to the person directly below the president in rank
After three years asvice-president, he became chief executive officer.
